alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 22 at 4:40AM PST until December 26 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SATURDAY TO 9 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 14 with dangerous rip currents. Abnormally high tides around 7.2 to 7.4 feet are expected. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...From 3 AM Saturday to 9 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is expected during early morning high tides.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
